1.text: An unfriendly man pursues selfishness, and defies all sound judgment.

2.text: A fool has no delight in understanding, but only in revealing his own opinion.

3.text: When wickedness comes, contempt also comes, and with shame comes disgrace.

4.text: The words of a man’s mouth are like deep waters. The fountain of wisdom is like a flowing brook.

5.text: To be partial to the faces of the wicked is not good, nor to deprive the innocent of justice.

6.text: A fool’s lips come into strife, and his mouth invites beatings.

7.text: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

8.text: The words of a gossip are like dainty morsels: they go down into a person’s innermost parts.

9.text: One who is slack in his work is brother to him who is a master of destruction.

10.text: The name of Yahweh is a strong tower: the righteous run to him, and are safe.

11.text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, like an unscalable wall in his own imagination.

12.text: Before destruction the heart of man is proud, but before honor is humility.

13.text: He who gives answer before he hears, that is folly and shame to him.

14.text: A man’s spirit will sustain him in sickness, but a crushed spirit, who can bear?

15.text: The heart of the discerning gets knowledge. The ear of the wise seeks knowledge.

16.text: A man’s gift makes room for him, and brings him before great men.

17.text: He who pleads his cause first seems right; until another comes and questions him.

18.text: The lot settles disputes, and keeps strong ones apart.

19.text: A brother offended is more difficult than a fortified city; and disputes are like the bars of a castle.

20.text: A man’s stomach is filled with the fruit of his mouth. With the harvest of his lips he is satisfied.

21.text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; those who love it will eat its fruit.

22.text: Whoever finds a wife finds a good thing, and obtains favor of Yahweh.

23.text: The poor plead for mercy, but the rich answer harshly.

24.text: A man of many companions may be ruined, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
